name: Business Process Manager REST APIs
description: REST API for Business Process Manager

calls.name: Retrieve Model
calls.description: Retrieves the model data (BPD model) for a particular BPD

options.name: BPD ID
options.description: Business process definition ID. You can use the "v1/exposed/process" API to retrieve the list of business process definitions (BPDs) that are available to the user.

options.name: Snapshot ID
options.description: Snapshot ID for a particular process. Begins with "2064.xxx...."

options.name: Branch ID
options.description: The branch ID. Begins with "2063.xxx..."

options.name: Process Application ID
options.description: The process app ID begins with "2066.xxx". You can find the process app ID by selecting Other > Retrieve Process Applications.

calls.name: External Activity Model
calls.description: Retrieves the model data for an external activity

options.name: External Activity ID
options.description: ID of the external activity

options.name: Authoring
options.description: Select to retrieve the model for process documentation. The snapshot ID or branch ID option must be set when authoring is enabled.

options.name: Snapshot ID
options.description: Snapshot ID for a particular process. Begins with "2064.xxx...."

options.name: Branch ID
options.description: The branch ID. Begins with "2063.xxx..."

options.name: Process Application ID
options.description: The process app ID begins with "2066.xxx". You can find the process app ID by selecting Other > Retrieve Process Applications.

calls.name: Start Process
calls.description: Starts a new BPD instance

options.name: BPD ID
options.description: Business process definition ID. You can use the "v1/exposed/process" API to retrieve the list of business process definitions (BPDs) that are available to the user.

options.name: Snapshot ID
options.description: Snapshot ID for a particular process. Begins with "2064.xxx...."

options.name: Branch ID
options.description: The branch ID. Begins with "2063.xxx..."

options.name: Process Application ID
options.description: The process app ID begins with "2066.xxx". You can find the process app ID by selecting Other > Retrieve Process Applications.

options.name: Parameters
options.description: A string that contains a JSON expression that has one or more input parameter settings. Each of the variables is set in the context of the running process, for example ....params={"orderNumber":"5","customerName":{"firstName":"John","lastName":"Doe"}}

calls.name: Current State
calls.description: Returns the current state of a BPD instance

options.name: Process Instance ID
options.description: You can find the BPD instance ID, also known as a piid, by selecting Task API > Task Details.

options.name: Task Limit
options.description: The maximum number of tasks to be returned

options.name: Task Offset
options.description: Specifies the index (origin 0) of the first task instance to be returned from the result set

calls.name: Evaluate JavaScript
calls.description: Evaluates a JavaScript expression

options.name: Process Instance ID
options.description: You can find the BPD instance ID, also known as a piid, by selecting Task API > Task Details.

options.name: JavaScript Expression
options.description: The JavaScript expression to evaluate

calls.name: Update Due Date
calls.description: Sets a new due date on a BPD instance

options.name: Process Instance ID
options.description: You can find the BPD instance ID, also known as a piid, by selecting Task API > Task Details.

calls.name: Suspend Process
calls.description: Pauses a BPD instance

options.name: Process Instance ID
options.description: You can find the BPD instance ID, also known as a piid, by selecting Task API > Task Details.

calls.name: Resume Process
calls.description: Resumes a BPD instance

options.name: Process Instance ID
options.description: You can find the BPD instance ID, also known as a piid, by selecting Task API > Task Details.

calls.name: Retry Process
calls.description: Retries a BPD instance

options.name: Process Instance ID
options.description: You can find the BPD instance ID, also known as a piid, by selecting Task API > Task Details.

calls.name: Terminate Process
calls.description: Terminates a BPD instance

options.name: Process Instance ID
options.description: You can find the BPD instance ID, also known as a piid, by selecting Task API > Task Details.

calls.name: Delete Process
calls.description: Deletes a BPD instance

options.name: Process Instance ID
options.description: You can find the BPD instance ID, also known as a piid, by selecting Task API > Task Details.

calls.name: Process Bulk Operation
calls.description: Performs the same operation against a list of process instances

options.name: Instance IDs
options.description: A comma-separated list of instance IDs or process IDs, also known as a piids. You can find these IDs by selecting Task API > Task Details.

options.name: Action
options.description: The action to perform

calls.name: Instance Error Details
calls.description: Retrieves detailed error information for one or more process instances

options.name: Instance IDs
options.description: A comma-separated list of instance IDs or process IDs, also known as a piids. You can find these IDs by selecting Task API > Task Details.

calls.name: Run Ad Hoc Event
calls.description: Runs an ad hoc event in the BPD instance. The available ad hoc steps are available from the BPD model.

options.name: Process Instance ID
options.description: You can find the BPD instance ID, also known as a piid, by selecting Task API > Task Details.

options.name: Step
options.description: Step

calls.name: Delete Token
calls.description: Delete a token from a BPD instance

options.name: Process Instance ID
options.description: You can find the BPD instance ID, also known as a piid, by selecting Task API > Task Details.

options.name: Token ID
options.description: The token ID

options.name: Resume
options.description: Resumes a BPD instance

calls.name: Move Token
calls.description: Move a token to a new activity

options.name: Process Instance ID
options.description: You can find the BPD instance ID, also known as a piid, by selecting Task API > Task Details.

options.name: Token ID
options.description: The token ID

options.name: Target
options.description: The target step ID

options.name: Resume
options.description: Resumes a BPD instance

calls.name: Add Comment
calls.description: Adds a comment to a BPD instance

options.name: Process Instance ID
options.description: You can find the BPD instance ID, also known as a piid, by selecting Task API > Task Details.

options.name: Comment
options.description: The comment message

options.name: Original Comment ID
options.description: The original comment ID, for threaded comments

calls.name: Add Document
calls.description: Adds a document to a BPD instance

options.name: Process Instance ID
options.description: You can find the BPD instance ID, also known as a piid, by selecting Task API > Task Details.

options.name: Name
options.description: Name of the document

options.name: Type
options.description: Type of document

options.name: Document File
options.description: File path of the document

options.name: Document URL
options.description: URL to the document

options.name: Document Text
options.description: Document text contents

calls.name: Update Document
calls.description: Updates a document associated with a BPD instance

options.name: Process Instance ID
options.description: You can find the BPD instance ID, also known as a piid, by selecting Task API > Task Details.

options.name: Document ID
options.description: ID of the document

options.name: Type
options.description: Type of document

options.name: Document File
options.description: File path of the document

options.name: Document URL
options.description: URL to the document

options.name: Document Text
options.description: Document text contents

calls.name: Delete Document
calls.description: Deletes a document from a BPD instance

options.name: Process Instance ID
options.description: You can find the BPD instance ID, also known as a piid, by selecting Task API > Task Details.

options.name: Document ID
options.description: ID of the document

calls.name: Task Summary
calls.description: Retrieves a list of task summaries for a particular BPD instance

options.name: Process Instance ID
options.description: You can find the BPD instance ID, also known as a piid, by selecting Task API > Task Details.

options.name: Status Filter
options.description: The task statuses to filter on

options.name: Offset
options.description: Specifies the number of entities to be skipped. Offset 0 refers to the first entity from the result set.If this parameter is not specified, the default value of 0 is used.

options.name: Size
options.description: Specifies the maximum number of entities to be returned. If a number is not specified, the default size defined for the query will be used.

calls.name: Process Queries
calls.description: Retrieves a list of queries for BPD instance data

options.name: Kind
options.description: The kind attribute for the queries, which is used as a filter

options.name: Content
options.description: Specifies a comma-separated list of content values. When you use this parameter, only queries that return the specified content values in their result set are returned. For example, if you specified content=TASK.PRIORITY,TASK.TKIID in your request URI query string, the response includes only those queries that return both content types.

options.name: includeTaskData
options.description: A string that indicates whether the response should include task information data. Valid values are TRUE and FALSE. The default value is FALSE.

calls.name: Process Query Attributes
calls.description: Retrieves a list of attributes of a query for BPD instance data

options.name: Query Name
options.description: Name of the saved query

options.name: includeTaskData
options.description: A string that indicates whether the response should include task information data. Valid values are TRUE and FALSE. The default value is FALSE.

calls.name: Process Query Entity List
calls.description: Retrieves a list of BPD instance entities obtained via a query

options.name: Query Name
options.description: Name of the saved query

options.name: Selected Attributes
options.description: Comma-separated list of attributes, in uppercase letters, which specifies the attributes that the query retrieves. If no attributes are specified, all the attributes that are defined on the query are returned.

options.name: Interaction Filter
options.description: Name of a predefined user interaction

options.name: Query Filter
options.description: A query table condition language expression that performs additional filtering on the result set. All attributes defined on the query can be referenced.

options.name: Process Application Name
options.description: Name of the process application

options.name: Sort Attributes
options.description: Comma-separated list of sort criteria applied to the list of returned process instance entities. Each list entry has the form attribute [ASC|DESC]. ASC (ascending) is the default.

options.name: Offset
options.description: Specifies the number of entities to be skipped. Offset 0 refers to the first entity from the result set.If this parameter is not specified, the default value of 0 is used.

options.name: Size
options.description: Specifies the maximum number of entities to be returned. If a number is not specified, the default size defined for the query will be used.

options.name: includeTaskData
options.description: A string that indicates whether the response should include task information data. Valid values are TRUE and FALSE. The default value is FALSE.

options.name: Filter By Current User
options.description: A flag that is used only when an administrative user runs the request; otherwise, it is ignored. This parameter indicates whether the search results should be restricted to those entities that are associated with the current user. A value of false means that an unfiltered search will be performed, whereas a value of true indicates that the search results will be filtered by the current user. If the current user is an administrative user, the default is to perform a filtered search. If the current user is not an administrative user, this parameter is ignored and a filtered search is performed.

calls.name: Process Query Entity List Count
calls.description: Retrieves the number of BPD instance entities in a query meeting specified criteria

options.name: Query Name
options.description: Name of the saved query

options.name: Query Filter
options.description: A query table condition language expression that performs additional filtering on the result set. All attributes defined on the query can be referenced.

options.name: Offset
options.description: Specifies the number of entities to be skipped. Offset 0 refers to the first entity from the result set.If this parameter is not specified, the default value of 0 is used.

options.name: Size
options.description: Specifies the maximum number of entities to be returned. If a number is not specified, the default size defined for the query will be used.

options.name: Filter By Current User
options.description: A flag that is used only when an administrative user runs the request; otherwise, it is ignored. This parameter indicates whether the search results should be restricted to those entities that are associated with the current user. A value of false means that an unfiltered search will be performed, whereas a value of true indicates that the search results will be filtered by the current user. If the current user is an administrative user, the default is to perform a filtered search. If the current user is not an administrative user, this parameter is ignored and a filtered search is performed.

calls.name: Fire Timer
calls.description: Allows the current user to manually fire an inline or attached timer

options.name: Process Instance ID
options.description: You can find the BPD instance ID, also known as a piid, by selecting Task API > Task Details.

options.name: Timer Token ID
options.description: Token ID of the timer. You can find a token by selecting Task API > Task Details.

calls.name: Send Message
calls.description: Allows the current user to target an event message to the given process instance

options.name: Message
options.description: Message to be sent

calls.name: Currently Running Instances
calls.description: Lists all processes that are currently running instances

calls.name: Exposed Processes
calls.description: Retrieves exposed processes

calls.name: Show Process Actions
calls.description: Retrieves a list of actions (both adh oc and standard) that are available to the current user for the specified process instance

options.name: Process Instance ID
options.description: You can find the BPD instance ID, also known as a piid, by selecting Task API > Task Details.

calls.name: Process Actions
calls.description: Retrieves a list of actions that can be performed on process instances

options.name: Instance IDs
options.description: A comma-separated list of instance IDs or process IDs, also known as a piids. You can find these IDs by selecting Task API > Task Details.

options.name: Actions
options.description: A comma-separated list of actions

calls.name: Bulk Instance Details
calls.description: Retrieves the details for a set of instances

options.name: Instance IDs
options.description: A comma-separated list of instance IDs or process IDs, also known as a piids. You can find these IDs by selecting Task API > Task Details.

calls.name: Ad Hoc Activities
calls.description: Returns a list of ad hoc activities.

options.name: Process Instance ID
options.description: You can find the BPD instance ID, also known as a piid, by selecting Task API > Task Details.

calls.name: Process Instances Status Overview
calls.description: Retrieves the number of BPD instance entities based on their status

options.name: Modified After
options.description: Include only the number of BPD instances that occur on or after the specified date. The date must be in ISO8601 format, such as 2011-08-04T03:12:53Z.

options.name: Modified Before
options.description: Include only the number of BPD instances that occur on or before the specified date. The date must be in ISO8601 format, such as 2011-08-04T03:12:53Z.

options.name: User Filter
options.description: Include only the number of BPD instances associated with the specified user

options.name: Search Filter
options.description: A search expression that is used as input to the task search engine

options.name: Search Filter Scope
options.description: Specifies the scope of the search filter. Supported values are AppShortName, InstanceName or Both. The default value is Both.

calls.name: Process Instances Search
calls.description: Retrieves a list of BPD instances and the number of BPD instance entities that they contain according to the status code

options.name: Modified After
options.description: Include only the number of BPD instances that occur on or after the specified date. The date must be in ISO8601 format, such as 2011-08-04T03:12:53Z.

options.name: Modified Before
options.description: Include only the number of BPD instances that occur on or before the specified date. The date must be in ISO8601 format, such as 2011-08-04T03:12:53Z.

options.name: User Filter
options.description: Include only the number of BPD instances associated with the specified user

options.name: Search Filter
options.description: Include only the number of BPD instances with the specified name, include only the number of BPD instances that belong to the process application with the specified short name, or include the total from both types of searches. The searchFilterScope parameter specifies which type of search to do.

options.name: Search Filter Scope
options.description: Specifies the scope of the search filter. Supported values are AppShortName, InstanceName or Both. The default value is Both.

options.name: Status Filter
options.description: Return the instances that have only the specified status. The list of status values is Active, Completed, Failed, Terminated, Suspended, Late, AtRisk. To specify more than one status value, separate each one with a comma such as Active,Late,Failed,AtRisk.

options.name: Project Filter
options.description: Return the instances for the specified projects identified by their acronyms (short names). To specify more than one project, separate each one with a comma such as APP1,APP2.

options.name: Offset
options.description: Specifies the number of entities to be skipped. Offset 0 refers to the first entity from the result set.If this parameter is not specified, the default value of 0 is used.

options.name: Limit
options.description: The maximum number of entities to be returned.

options.name: Sort By
options.description: How the entities are sorted: by last modified date or by severity

calls.name: Update Instance Variable
calls.description: Updates an instance variable value

options.name: Instance ID
options.description: Instance ID or process ID, also known as a piid. You can find this ID by selecting Task API > Task Details.

options.name: Variable Name
options.description: Variable Name

options.name: Request Body (variable value in JSON format)
options.description: Variable Value

calls.name: Update Instance Variables
calls.description: Updates instance variables (bulk update)

options.name: Instance ID
options.description: Instance ID or process ID, also known as a piid. You can find this ID by selecting Task API > Task Details.

options.name: Request Body (variable values in JSON format)
options.description: Values of the instance variables in JSON format

calls.name: Bulk Action with Search Filters
calls.description: Takes bulk action on instances that were retrieved by using the search filters

options.name: Action
options.description: The action to perform

options.name: Modified After
options.description: Include only the number of BPD instances that occur on or after the specified date. The date must be in ISO8601 format, such as 2011-08-04T03:12:53Z.

options.name: Modified Before
options.description: Include only the number of BPD instances that occur on or before the specified date. The date must be in ISO8601 format, such as 2011-08-04T03:12:53Z.

options.name: User Filter
options.description: Include only the number of BPD instances associated with the specified user

options.name: Search Filter
options.description: Include only the number of BPD instances with the specified name, include only the number of BPD instances that belong to the process application with the specified short name, or include the total from both types of searches. The searchFilterScope parameter specifies which type of search to do.

options.name: Search Filter Scope
options.description: Specifies the scope of the search filter. Supported values are AppShortName, InstanceName or Both. The default value is Both.

options.name: Status Filter
options.description: Return the instances that have only the specified status. The list of status values is Active, Completed, Failed, Terminated, Suspended, Late, AtRisk. To specify more than one status value, separate each one with a comma such as Active,Late,Failed,AtRisk.

options.name: Project Filter
options.description: Return the instances for the specified projects identified by their acronyms (short names). To specify more than one project, separate each one with a comma such as APP1,APP2.

options.name: Sort By
options.description: How the entities are sorted: by last modified date or by severity

options.name: Offset
options.description: Specifies the number of entities to be skipped. Offset 0 refers to the first entity from the result set.If this parameter is not specified, the default value of 0 is used.

options.name: Limit
options.description: The maximum number of entities to be returned.

calls.name: Get Dependent Process
calls.description: Returns a process instance that is dependent on the current process instance.

options.name: Process Instance ID
options.description: You can find the BPD instance ID, also known as a piid, by selecting Task API > Task Details.

calls.name: Get Depended on Processes
calls.description: Returns a list of process instances on which the current process instance is dependent.

options.name: Process Instance ID
options.description: You can find the BPD instance ID, also known as a piid, by selecting Task API > Task Details.

options.name: Status Filter
options.description: A filter to return only process instances that only have the specified status. Multiple status values can be specified by separating each value with a comma. Valid values are 'Active', 'Completed', 'Failed', 'Terminated', 'Did_not_Start', 'Suspended'.

calls.name: Get Related Processes
calls.description: Returns a list of process instances that have independent relationships with the current process instance.

options.name: Process Instance ID
options.description: You can find the BPD instance ID, also known as a piid, by selecting Task API > Task Details.

options.name: Status Filter
options.description: A filter to return only process instances that only have the specified status. Multiple status values can be specified by separating each value with a comma. Valid values are 'Active', 'Completed', 'Failed', 'Terminated', 'Did_not_Start', 'Suspended'.

calls.name: Get Process Relationships
calls.description: Returns a list of relationships associated with the process instance.

options.name: Process Instance ID
options.description: You can find the BPD instance ID, also known as a piid, by selecting Task API > Task Details.

options.name: Type
options.description: The type of the relationship. 'INDEPENDENT' is an independent relationship. 'DEPENDENT' - prevents completion of the current process instance until the instance that it depends on completes.

calls.name: Create or Remove Process Instance Relationship
calls.description: Creates or removes a relationship between two process instances.

options.name: Process Instance ID
options.description: You can find the BPD instance ID, also known as a piid, by selecting Task API > Task Details.

options.name: Type
options.description: The type of the relationship. 'INDEPENDENT' is an independent relationship. 'DEPENDENT' - prevents completion of the current process instance until the instance that it depends on completes.

options.name: Target Id
options.description: The process instance ID of the instance to which the relationship is being created or removed.

options.name: Description
options.description: The new description for the relationship.

calls.name: Retrieve Model
calls.description: Retrieves the model data (service model) for a particular service

options.name: Service ID or Name
options.description: A service model ID or a string of the form <project-acronym>@<service-name>

options.name: Snapshot ID
options.description: Snapshot ID for a particular process. Begins with "2064.xxx...."

options.name: Process Application ID
options.description: The process app ID begins with "2066.xxx". You can find the process app ID by selecting Other > Retrieve Process Applications.

calls.name: Start Service
calls.description: Runs a service until a natural stop (either a coach, postpone, or the end)

options.name: Service ID or Name
options.description: A service model ID or a string of the form <project-acronym>@<service-name>

options.name: Parameters
options.description: A string that contains a JSON expression that has one or more input parameter settings. Each of the variables is set in the context of the running process, for example ....params={"orderNumber":"5","customerName":{"firstName":"John","lastName":"Doe"}}

options.name: Snapshot ID
options.description: Snapshot ID for a particular process. Begins with "2064.xxx...."

options.name: Create Task
options.description: Indicates whether a corresponding task should be created when starting the service.

options.name: Caller Task ID
options.description: The ID of an existing task that can be associated with the new service instance. If a task ID is not specified, the new service instance will not be associated with an existing task. For Ajax services, this setting is also used to check whether the current user is authorized to start the Ajax service in the context of a task implemented by an external activity.

calls.name: Resume Service
calls.description: Resumes a running service or task until a natural stop (either a coach, postpone, or the end)

options.name: Service Instance ID
options.description: The service instance ID, which is the value that is returned as the "key" element within the ServiceRunModel response when starting a service

options.name: Button or Endpoint
options.description: Represents buttons or endPoints on a coach

calls.name: Evaluate JavaScript
calls.description: Evaluates a JavaScript expression against a currently running service

options.name: Service Instance ID
options.description: The service instance ID, which is the value that is returned as the "key" element within the ServiceRunModel response when starting a service

options.name: JavaScript Expression
options.description: The JavaScript expression to evaluate

calls.name: Get Data
calls.description: Retrieves a value from a field

options.name: Service Instance ID or Task ID
options.description: Either a service instance ID (a string of the form @<nnnn> where <nnnn> is a string of digits) or a task instance ID (a string of digits). You can find the service instance ID in the "key" field that is returned in the response of selecting Service API > Start Service. You can find the task instance ID in the "task.tkiid" fields that are returned in the response of selecting Process API > Current State.

options.name: Fields
options.description: A comma-separated list of fields

calls.name: Set Data
calls.description: Sets a value to a field

options.name: Service Instance ID or Task ID
options.description: Either a service instance ID (a string of the form @<nnnn> where <nnnn> is a string of digits) or a task instance ID (a string of digits). You can find the service instance ID in the "key" field that is returned in the response of selecting Service API > Start Service. You can find the task instance ID in the "task.tkiid" fields that are returned in the response of selecting Process API > Current State.

options.name: Parameters
options.description: A string that contains a JSON expression that has one or more input parameter settings. Each of the variables is set in the context of the running process, for example ....params={"orderNumber":"5","customerName":{"firstName":"John","lastName":"Doe"}}

calls.name: Stop Service
calls.description: Stops a service

options.name: Service Instance ID
options.description: The service instance ID, which is the value that is returned as the "key" element within the ServiceRunModel response when starting a service

calls.name: Currently Running
calls.description: Lists all services for this user that are currently running

calls.name: Exposed Services
calls.description: Retrieves exposed services

options.name: Include Service Subtypes
options.description: A comma-separated list of one or more service subtypes to be included in the result set. If service subtypes are not specified, all service subtypes are included.

calls.name: Task Details
calls.description: Retrieves the details of a task

options.name: Task ID
options.description: ID of the task

calls.name: Get Data
calls.description: Retrieves a value from a field

options.name: Task ID
options.description: ID of the task

options.name: Fields
options.description: A comma-separated list of fields

calls.name: Set Data
calls.description: Sets a value to a field

options.name: Task ID
options.description: ID of the task

options.name: Parameters
options.description: A string that contains a JSON expression that has one or more input parameter settings. Each of the variables is set in the context of the running process, for example ....params={"orderNumber":"5","customerName":{"firstName":"John","lastName":"Doe"}}

calls.name: Bulk Task Details
calls.description: Retrieves the details for a set of tasks

options.name: Task IDs
options.description: A comma-separated list of task IDs

calls.name: Start Task
calls.description: Starts a task

options.name: Task ID
options.description: ID of the task

calls.name: Assign Task To User
calls.description: Assigns a task to a user.

options.name: Task ID
options.description: ID of the task

options.name: To User
options.description: Assign to a particular user

calls.name: Assign Task To Group
calls.description: Assign a task to a group.

options.name: Task ID
options.description: ID of the task

options.name: To Group
options.description: Assign to a particular group

calls.name: Assign Task To Me
calls.description: Assign a task to the current user.

options.name: Task ID
options.description: ID of the task

calls.name: Assign Task Back
calls.description: Assign a task to the original owner.

options.name: Task ID
options.description: ID of the task

calls.name: Update Due Date
calls.description: Sets a new due date on a task

options.name: Task ID
options.description: ID of the task

calls.name: Update Priority
calls.description: Sets a new priority on a task

options.name: Task ID
options.description: ID of the task

options.name: Priority
options.description: Priority value e.g. Highest/10, High/20, Normal/30, Low/40 or Lowest/50

calls.name: Finish Task
calls.description: Closes a task

options.name: Task ID
options.description: ID of the task

options.name: Parameters
options.description: Parameters to finish the task or activity

calls.name: Cancel Task
calls.description: Cancels a task

options.name: Task ID
options.description: ID of the task

calls.name: Task Client Settings
calls.description: Retrieves client settings for a specific task instance

options.name: Task ID
options.description: ID of the task

options.name: Type
options.description: Client type. The only predefined value is "IBM_WLE_Coach".

calls.name: Task Actions
calls.description: Retrieves a list of actions that can be performed on task instances

options.name: Task IDs
options.description: A comma-separated list of task IDs

options.name: Actions
options.description: A comma-separated list of actions that the caller is interested in, used as a filter for the response. If actions are not specified, information about all possible actions is returned.

calls.name: Task Queries
calls.description: Retrieves a list of queries for task instance data.

options.name: Process Application Name
options.description: Name of the process application

options.name: Kind
options.description: The kind attribute for the queries, which is used as a filter

options.name: Content
options.description: Specifies a comma-separated list of content values. When you use this parameter, only queries that return the specified content values in their result set are returned. For example, if you specified content=TASK.PRIORITY,TASK.TKIID in your request URI query string, the response includes only those queries that return both content types.

calls.name: Task Query Attributes
calls.description: Retrieves a list of attributes of a query for task instance data

options.name: Query Name
options.description: Name of the saved query

options.name: Process Application Name
options.description: Name of the process application

calls.name: Task Query Entity List
calls.description: Retrieves a list of task instance entities obtained by using a query.

options.name: Query Name
options.description: Name of the saved query

options.name: Selected Attributes
options.description: Comma-separated list of attributes, in uppercase letters, which specifies the attributes that the query retrieves. If no attributes are specified, all the attributes that are defined on the query are returned.

options.name: Interaction Filter
options.description: Name of a predefined user interaction

options.name: Query Filter
options.description: A query table condition language expression that performs additional filtering on the result set. All attributes defined on the query can be referenced.

options.name: Search Filter
options.description: A search expression that is used as input to the task search engine

options.name: Process Application Name
options.description: Name of the process application

options.name: Sort Attributes
options.description: Comma-separated list of sort criteria applied to the list of returned process instance entities. Each list entry has the form attribute [ASC|DESC]. ASC (ascending) is the default.

options.name: Offset
options.description: Specifies the number of entities to be skipped. Offset 0 refers to the first entity from the result set.If this parameter is not specified, the default value of 0 is used.

options.name: Size
options.description: Specifies the maximum number of entities to be returned. If a number is not specified, the default size defined for the query will be used.

options.name: Filter By Current User
options.description: A flag that is used only when an administrative user runs the request; otherwise, it is ignored. This parameter indicates whether the search results should be restricted to those entities that are associated with the current user. A value of false means that an unfiltered search will be performed, whereas a value of true indicates that the search results will be filtered by the current user. If the current user is an administrative user, the default is to perform a filtered search. If the current user is not an administrative user, this parameter is ignored and a filtered search is performed.

options.name: Calculate Stats
options.description: Calculate task statistics

calls.name: Task Query Entity List Count
calls.description: Retrieves the number of task instance entities that meet specified criteria in a query

options.name: Query Name
options.description: Name of the saved query

options.name: Interaction Filter
options.description: Name of a predefined user interaction

options.name: Query Filter
options.description: A query table condition language expression that performs additional filtering on the result set. All attributes defined on the query can be referenced.

options.name: Search Filter
options.description: A search expression that is used as input to the task search engine

options.name: Filter By Current User
options.description: A flag that is used only when an administrative user runs the request; otherwise, it is ignored. This parameter indicates whether the search results should be restricted to those entities that are associated with the current user. A value of false means that an unfiltered search will be performed, whereas a value of true indicates that the search results will be filtered by the current user. If the current user is an administrative user, the default is to perform a filtered search. If the current user is not an administrative user, this parameter is ignored and a filtered search is performed.

calls.name: Run Query
calls.description: Performs a custom search

options.name: Columns
options.description: A comma-separated list of column names that the search should return. Valid column names are taskId, instanceId, bpdName, taskSubject, taskArrived, taskStarted, taskFinished, plus any columns that are associated with tracked business data. If this parameter is not specified, then the following columns are returned by default: "taskId", "instanceId", "bpdName", and "taskSubject".

options.name: Condition
options.description: Query condition: "<field>|<value>" or "<field>|<op>|<value>"

options.name: Sort
options.description: Name of primary sort column

options.name: Second Sort
options.description: Name of secondary sort column

options.name: Organization
options.description: A string indicating how the results should be organized. Valid values are byTask and byInstance. The default value is byInstance.

options.name: Size
options.description: Specifies the maximum number of entities to be returned. If a number is not specified, the default size defined for the query will be used.

options.name: Offset
options.description: Specifies the number of entities to be skipped. Offset 0 refers to the first entity from the result set.If this parameter is not specified, the default value of 0 is used.

options.name: Save as Name
options.description: Saves this custom query as a saved search for this user

options.name: Perform Query
options.description: A flag that indicates whether to perform the query. If this parameter is not specified, the default value of true is used.

options.name: Share Query with Other Users
options.description: A flag that indicates whether to share the query with other users. If this parameter is not specified, the default value of false is used.

options.name: Filter By Current User
options.description: A flag that is used only when an administrative user runs the request; otherwise, it is ignored. This parameter indicates whether the search results should be restricted to those entities that are associated with the current user. A value of false means that an unfiltered search will be performed, whereas a value of true indicates that the search results will be filtered by the current user. If the current user is an administrative user, the default is to perform a filtered search. If the current user is not an administrative user, this parameter is ignored and a filtered search is performed.

calls.name: Execute Performance Query
calls.description: Performs a custom query against the performance server

options.name: Filter
options.description: A string that represents a filter to be used in the search

options.name: Columns
options.description: A comma-separated list of column names that the search should return. Valid column names are taskId, instanceId, bpdName, taskSubject, taskArrived, taskStarted, taskFinished, plus any columns that are associated with tracked business data. If this parameter is not specified, then the following columns are returned by default: "taskId", "instanceId", "bpdName", and "taskSubject".

options.name: Sort
options.description: Name of primary sort column

options.name: Second Sort
options.description: Name of secondary sort column

options.name: Condition
options.description: Query condition: "<field>|<value>" or "<field>|<op>|<value>"

options.name: Only Rollups
options.description: Returns only summarized data (true/false)

options.name: Rollup Rule
options.description: Formula to use for summarizing the data (AVG, SUM, MIN, MAX, COUNT)

options.description: You can find the BPD instance ID, also known as a piid, by selecting Task API > Task Details.

options.description: The type of metadata to be returned

categories.name: Organization API
categories.description: REST API pertaining to users and groups

calls.name: Users
calls.description: Returns a list of users

options.name: Name Filter
options.description: An optional simple regular expression to be used to filter the list of groups returned, for example "tw_*" will return all groups whose names begin with "tw_"

options.name: Maximum Results
options.description: The maximum number of users to return (optional)

options.name: Reassign Task ID
options.description: Include only users who can be assigned this task (optional)

options.name: Collaboration Task ID
options.description: Include only users who can collaborate on this task (optional)

options.name: Include Experts
options.description: Include experts in list of users who can collaborate (optional)

options.name: Sort
options.description: Sort the list by name (optional)

options.name: Include Internal Memberships
options.description: Includes internal memberships when membership information is returned

options.name: Refresh User
options.description: Refreshes fullname and group memberships of users for member of the group that the ACTION_REFRESH_USER policyAction refers to

options.name: Document File

calls.name: Exposed Scoreboards
calls.description: Retrieves exposed scoreboards

calls.name: Exposed Reports
calls.description: Retrieves exposed reports

calls.name: Exposed Items (All)
calls.description: Retrieves all items exposed to the user: processes (BPDs), services, reports and scoreboards

options.name: Include Service Subtypes
options.description: A comma-separated list of one or more service subtypes to be included in the result set. If service subtypes are not specified, all service subtypes are included.

options.name: Exclude Referenced from Toolkit
options.description: Comma-separated list of types or service subtypes that should be excluded from referenced toolkits.

options.name: Exclude Process Start URL
options.description: When true, the process start URL will not be returned.

calls.name: Retrieve Alert Definitions
calls.description: Retrieves the alert definitions that are associated with the categories specified

options.name: Categories
options.description: A comma-separated list of categories that indicate which alert definitions to retrieve

calls.name: Save Alert Definitions
calls.description: Saves the list of alert definitions in the database

options.name: Parameters
options.description: A string that contains a JSON expression that has a list of alert definitions to save

options.name: Import mode
options.description: Save alert definitions in import mode without validating that the associated artifacts exist. When this optional parameter is set to true, the system also ignores the ID property to prevent the imported alert definitions from overwriting existing alert definitions with the same ID. By default the import mode is set to false.

calls.name: Delete Alert Definition
calls.description: Deletes the list of alert definitions specified

options.name: Alert Definition IDs
options.description: A comma-separated list of alert definition IDs to check

calls.name: Retrieve Alert Definitions Status
calls.description: Returns the current run time values for the list of alert definitions specified, including the actual values and whether the conditions were met

options.name: Alert Definition IDs
options.description: A comma-separated list of alert definition IDs to check

calls.name: Retrieve Instance Stream
calls.description: Retrieves the activity stream for a specific BPD instance

options.name: Instance ID
options.description: The instance ID or BPD instance ID, also known as a piid. You can find this ID by selecting Task API > Task Details.

options.name: Sort Order
options.description: The sort order. Choose asc for ascending or desc for descending. The default option is desc.

options.name: Page
options.description: The page of items to return. The default is no paging. Pages start at 1. Using 0 disables paging.

options.name: Page Size
options.description: The number of items to return on a page. The default is 10.

options.name: Since
options.description: A filter for returning items available only since this date/time. The format is year-month-day-time, such as 2010-10-10T00:00:00.

calls.name: Retrieve Mentions
calls.description: Retrieves a stream of items in which the current user was mentioned

options.name: Sort Order
options.description: The sort order. Choose asc for ascending or desc for descending. The default option is desc.

options.name: Page
options.description: The page of items to return. The default is no paging. Pages start at 1. Using 0 disables paging.

options.name: Page Size
options.description: The number of items to return on a page. The default is 10.

options.name: Since
options.description: A filter for returning items available only since this date/time. The format is year-month-day-time, such as 2010-10-10T00:00:00.

calls.name: Delete Mentions
calls.description: Deletes a mentioned item

options.name: Task ID
options.description: Task ID, the unique integer ID of the task

calls.name: Delete All Mentions
calls.description: Deletes all mentioned items for current user

calls.name: Retrieve All Following
calls.description: Returns the list of all instances that the current user is following

calls.name: Retrieve Following Instance
calls.description: Returns true if the current user is following a specific BPD instance

options.name: Instance ID
options.description: The instance ID or BPD instance ID, also known as a piid. You can find this ID by selecting Task API > Task Details.

calls.name: Start Following Instance
calls.description: Allows user to start following a specific BPD instance

options.name: Instance ID
options.description: The instance ID or BPD instance ID, also known as a piid. You can find this ID by selecting Task API > Task Details.

calls.name: Stop Following Instance
calls.description: Allows user to stop following a specific BPD instance

options.name: Instance ID
options.description: The instance ID or BPD instance ID, also known as a piid. You can find this ID by selecting Task API > Task Details.

calls.name: Retrieve Task Stream
calls.description: Retrieves the activity stream for the BPD instance associated with a given task

options.name: Task ID
options.description: Task ID, the unique integer ID of the task

options.name: Sort Order
options.description: The sort order. Choose asc for ascending or desc for descending. The default option is desc.

options.name: Page
options.description: The page of items to return. The default is no paging. Pages start at 1. Using 0 disables paging.

options.name: Page Size
options.description: The number of items to return on a page. The default is 10.

options.name: Since
options.description: A filter for returning items available only since this date/time. The format is year-month-day-time, such as 2010-10-10T00:00:00.

calls.name: Post Threaded Comment
calls.description: Allows posting a threaded comment to an existing comment or task

options.name: Task ID
options.description: Task ID, the unique integer ID of the task

options.name: Comment
options.description: Comment message

calls.name: Retrieve Following Task
calls.description: Returns true if the current user is following a specific task

options.name: Task ID
options.description: Task ID, the unique integer ID of the task

calls.name: Start Following Task
calls.description: Allows user to start following a specific task

options.name: Task ID
options.description: Task ID, the unique integer ID of the task

calls.name: Stop Following Task
calls.description: Allows user to stop following a specific task

options.name: Task ID
options.description: Task ID, the unique integer ID of the task

calls.name: Retrieve User''s Expert Data
calls.description: Retrieves the expert information for a single specific user

options.name: Task ID
options.description: Task ID, the unique integer ID of the task

options.name: User Name
options.description: User name

calls.name: Task Experts
calls.description: Retrieves experts information for a specific task

options.name: Task ID
options.description: Task ID, the unique integer ID of the task

calls.name: Retrieve User Avatar
calls.description: Retrieves the avatar image for a specific user

options.name: User Name
options.description: Name of the user

calls.name: Retrieve Avatar
calls.description: Retrieves the avatar image for the current user

calls.name: Delete Avatar
calls.description: Deletes the avatar image for the current user

calls.name: Collaboration System Integration Details
calls.description: Retrieves the connection information for a defined collaboration system, such as IBM Sametime or IBM Connections

calls.name: Send Event
calls.description: Sends an ECM event to IBM Business Process Manager

options.name: Event Source ID
options.description: ID of the ECM server repository sending the event.

options.name: Object Type ID
options.description: ID of the object type of the object that the event occurred on

options.name: Event Type
options.description: Type of the event

options.name: Object ID
options.description: ID of the object instance that the event occurred on

calls.name: Update or Remove Relationship
calls.description: Updates relationship properties, or removes a relationship between two instances.

options.name: Relationship ID
options.description: The ID of the relationship.

options.name: Description
options.description: The new description for the relationship.
